definition: A contorted facial expression typically used to convey exaggerated emotions or to entertain others, often associated with theatrical performances, comedy, or clowning.

examples.german: Sie zog eine Grimasse, als sie den Geschmack des Essens probierte.
examples.english: She made a grimace when she tasted the food.

examples.german: Der Clown machte lustige Grimassen, um die Kinder zum Lachen zu bringen.
examples.english: The clown made funny grimaces to make the children laugh.

examples.german: Er versuchte, seine Angst zu verbergen, aber eine Grimasse entkam ihm.
examples.english: He tried to hide his fear, but a grimace escaped him.
